question: Which Indian state has announced its own new Industrial Policy 2020, with an annual outlay of Rs 8000 crore?
explanation:
The state government of Gujarat has announced its new Industrial Policy 2020 for the State, with an expected annual outlay of up to Rs 8000 crore.
The policy aims to attract investments for job creation, value-addition, adoption of technology among others. Under the policy, Industries will be able to get government land for projects on long-term lease up to 50 years, at 6 per cent of the market rate.
